As the following part of API-WG guidline[1],

  If a request contains a reference to a nonexistent resource in the
  body (not URI), the code should be 400 Bad Request. Do not use 404
  NotFound because :rfc:`7231#section-6.5.4` (section 6.5.4) mentions
  the origin server did not find a current representation for the
  target resource for 404 and representation for the target resource
  means a URI

Nova should return a BadRequest response(400) in this case, because
new_volume_id is specified in a request body. old_volume_id is not
necessary to be changed because the value is specified with URI.
So it is valid to return NotFound response if that is not existent.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/http.rst#failure-code-clarifications

Close-Bug: #1629110
Change-Id: Ib781b116f5af713d64b5880858cc4f81c3da3977
(cherry picked from commit edd86d9dac1ea75bc580a7964e7d699ee9644b19)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error status code on update-volume API

As the following part of API-WG guidline[1],

  If a request contains a reference to a nonexistent resource in the
  body (not URI), the code should be 400 Bad Request. Do not use 404
  NotFound because :rfc:`7231#section-6.5.4` (section 6.5.4) mentions
  the origin server did not find a current representation for the
  target resource for 404 and representation for the target resource
  means a URI

Nova should return a BadRequest response(400) in this case, because
new_volume_id is specified in a request body. old_volume_id is not
necessary to be changed because the value is specified with URI.
So it is valid to return NotFound response if that is not existent.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/http.rst#failure-code-clarifications

Close-Bug: #1629110
Change-Id: Ib781b116f5af713d64b5880858cc4f81c3da3977
(cherry picked from commit edd86d9dac1ea75bc580a7964e7d699ee9644b19)

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Testing private OVS with IDL mutate fix.

This commit reverts the workaround added to support getattr
after performing a mutate operation using OVS Python IDL.
The commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/380185/ stopped
using mutate in the code paths where a getattr was done after
a mutate operation (but before commit). This commit undoes
that change.

Change-Id: Ifdc03300c7bbcd535c076eb5f9d594ccfa201024
Related-Bug: 1629099

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 19:28:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_nfs.py', 'cinder/backup/drivers/nfs.py'], 'message': "Fix backup NFS share mount with default backup_mount_options

Now, if backup_mount_options in not set, NFS Backup driver
passes empty dict to RemoteFsClient. It cause an error when
RemoteFsClient mounts the share because it passes '-o {}' params.

According to [1] we should pass None to RemoteFsClient if no
backup_mount_options was specified.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/remotefs/remotefs.py#L129-L130

Change-Id: Ief874332a71ff77c88a65e2d631457b831472236
Closes-Bug: #1529566
"}]
commit_message:
Fix backup NFS share mount with default backup_mount_options

Now, if backup_mount_options in not set, NFS Backup driver
passes empty dict to RemoteFsClient. It cause an error when
RemoteFsClient mounts the share because it passes '-o {}' params.

According to [1] we should pass None to RemoteFsClient if no
backup_mount_options was specified.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/remotefs/remotefs.py#L129-L130

Change-Id: Ief874332a71ff77c88a65e2d631457b831472236
Closes-Bug: #1529566

commit_message:
Proposal for cells v2 scheduling interaction

The scheduler should be called earlier in the build process so that an
instance can be created in the proper cell.

This spec has been previously approved in Newton but minor modifications
have been made in this version. Details have been added about the need
for a new conductor method.

blueprint cells-scheduling-interaction

Change-Id: I9a3cf1bec13143771231aa3602c0a955c847ca47

subject: Use dictionary for service group mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 14:11:20.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_init_common.yml', 'tasks/nova_init_systemd.yml', 'templates/nova-systemd-tempfiles.j2', 'templates/nova-upstart-init.j2', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_init.yml', 'templates/nova-systemd-init.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_init_upstart.yml'], 'message': "Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'nova_service_names' from a list to a dictionary mapping
of services, groups that install those services. This brings the
method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order to
implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: I53fb0ab1cc5762e3559d4ee2635d4cca532df7e3
(cherry picked from commit 9a17ca682db8d9f90ae89004ae44c51024236ac6)
"}]
commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'nova_service_names' from a list to a dictionary mapping
of services, groups that install those services. This brings the
method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order to
implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: I53fb0ab1cc5762e3559d4ee2635d4cca532df7e3
(cherry picked from commit 9a17ca682db8d9f90ae89004ae44c51024236ac6)

subject: Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 14:33:03.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/ironic_install.yml'], 'message': "Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I7067a541362c826579fc7d17abf86fe9ddc89bee
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3a62eccb2cbb3b8071bb7b34007ee17d82eae311)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I7067a541362c826579fc7d17abf86fe9ddc89bee
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3a62eccb2cbb3b8071bb7b34007ee17d82eae311)

subject: Add support for the Ceph storage driver in Gnocchi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 08:16:16.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-gnocchi-install.yml'], 'message': 'Add support for the Ceph storage driver in Gnocchi

We call ceph_client before calling the os_gnocchi role. This ordering is
important because Gnocchi needs Ceph access to be ready to go when it
runs its DB sync task.

We pass an empty string to `openstack_service_venv_bin`. This is done
because the venv would not exist yet when the ceph_client role runs.
Symlinks for the Ceph Python libraries are created by the os_gnocchi
role itself.

Change-Id: Ia66c53f7ab6bb242b5aab1c5d01b96ca2fd7df97
(cherry picked from commit 56b87ea067523462b0ae272758ea7edd6dd1b706)
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for the Ceph storage driver in Gnocchi

We call ceph_client before calling the os_gnocchi role. This ordering is
important because Gnocchi needs Ceph access to be ready to go when it
runs its DB sync task.

We pass an empty string to `openstack_service_venv_bin`. This is done
because the venv would not exist yet when the ceph_client role runs.
Symlinks for the Ceph Python libraries are created by the os_gnocchi
role itself.

Change-Id: Ia66c53f7ab6bb242b5aab1c5d01b96ca2fd7df97
(cherry picked from commit 56b87ea067523462b0ae272758ea7edd6dd1b706)

commit_message:
Update os-testr to 0.8.0

Since a new version 0.8.0 of os-testr is released.
It adds following major improvements:
* Allow to specifiy black/white list at the same time
* Make subprocess outputs to text for Python 3
* Add --black-regex/-B option
* Add support for Python versions

Apart from that, This will help to drop ~100 line of (duplicated) code in tempest, after this version and less likely to have incompatibility issues between tempest and os-testr in the future versions.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/os-testr/history.html

Change-Id: Idbe484c193b10c3dac1b035744c383c458b344f6
(cherry picked from commit f193148f9fe2cee27d674dbb97386e4dd8712e96)

commit_message:
Add negative tests for deleting attached volume

Due to lack of an error handling, Nova's delete-volume API returns
HTTP500 error when deleting an attached volume.
This patch adds the corresponding test for reproducing the problem
on the gate and blocking the same issue in the future.

Change-Id: Idb6267be770bcf2541595babebf269cdc71c2b8d
Depends-On: Ia07556b2dc18678baa4c8fbd65820d8047362ef9
Related-Bug: #1630783

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any

commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I5ceece61312e2bf39d7489261bca247f353d6d74
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6c902fc47191d3918658171504eb0d1cd751175d)

commit_message:
Add error handling for delete-volume API

Due to lack of an error handling, delete-volume API returns HTTP500
error when deleting an attached volume.
This patch adds the error handling.

The corresponding Tempest test is Idb6267be770bcf2541595babebf269cdc71c2b8d

Closes-Bug: #1630783
Change-Id: Ia07556b2dc18678baa4c8fbd65820d8047362ef9
(cherry picked from commit 2afc4e466958b19a4cbb9147abb69f54a06bd507)

subject: Use dictionary for service group mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-14 14:01:22.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_init_common.yml', 'tasks/cinder_init_upstart.yml', 'templates/cinder-upstart-init.j2', 'handlers/main.yml', 'templates/cinder-systemd-init.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_init.yml', 'templates/cinder-systemd-tempfiles.j2', 'tasks/cinder_init_systemd.yml'], 'message': "Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'cinder_service_names' from a list to a dictionary
mapping of services, groups that install those services. This brings
the method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order
to implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

This is a combined backport of:
 - https://review.openstack.org/377055
 - https://review.openstack.org/378720

Change-Id: Ifeb890cc733921a6f882e4d9cdb778e22c82e9c5
"}]
commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'cinder_service_names' from a list to a dictionary
mapping of services, groups that install those services. This brings
the method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order
to implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

This is a combined backport of:
 - https://review.openstack.org/377055
 - https://review.openstack.org/378720

Change-Id: Ifeb890cc733921a6f882e4d9cdb778e22c82e9c5

subject: Do not ignore_errors for fallback keyserver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-16 13:34:42.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_install_yum.yml'], 'message': 'Do not ignore_errors for fallback keyserver

The initial keyserver usage should ignore errors so that
the fallback keyserver can be used. However the second
task should not ignore errors as there is no third
keyserver - if the first has failed, and the fallback has
failed, then the task should fail and the installation
should stop.

Change-Id: I60fdbbde70f9bb14cfdf57e4c357f1cd0fc24f55
'}]
commit_message:
Do not ignore_errors for fallback keyserver

The initial keyserver usage should ignore errors so that
the fallback keyserver can be used. However the second
task should not ignore errors as there is no third
keyserver - if the first has failed, and the fallback has
failed, then the task should fail and the installation
should stop.

Change-Id: I60fdbbde70f9bb14cfdf57e4c357f1cd0fc24f55

commit_message:
Always setup ResellerAdmin role in keystone

The ResellerAdmin role should be setup in keystone regardless of whether
we are using Ceilometer or not. This will allow operators to add the
ResellerAdmin role to users - which should then be allowed to operate on
any account.

Change-Id: I3c5ede01266b126705b42b086107a9232a85bf94
Closes-Bug: #1633221
(cherry picked from commit 8e14baa7fb27d43d5845818660517938644db0b6)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7219, 'name': 'git-harry', 'email': 'git-harry@live.co.uk', 'username': 'git-harry'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 11268, 'name': 'Miguel Alex Cantu (alextricity25)', 'email': 'miguel.can2@gmail.com', 'username': 'elextro'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-10-14 18:42:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/upgrade-guide/manual-upgrade.rst', 'doc/source/upgrade-guide/upgrade-playbooks.rst', 'scripts/run-upgrade.sh', 'scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/neutron-mtu-migration.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron-mtu-migration-47bb099191d8c0e3.yaml'], 'message': 'Update the neutron MTU settings on upgrade

Update the MTU setting for networks within neutron. When migrating from
Liberty to Mitaka neutron does not automatically set or migrate networks.
Neutron has no migration to correctly set the MTU on existing networks
created in liberty or below. This work-around sets the MTU on these
networks before the upgrade starts so that instances booted on these
networks after the upgrade has finished will have their MTUs set
correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1620953
Change-Id: I001f3b940089ccd55a932433c2563c143670a4d1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update the neutron MTU settings on upgrade

Update the MTU setting for networks within neutron. When migrating from
Liberty to Mitaka neutron does not automatically set or migrate networks.
Neutron has no migration to correctly set the MTU on existing networks
created in liberty or below. This work-around sets the MTU on these
networks before the upgrade starts so that instances booted on these
networks after the upgrade has finished will have their MTUs set
correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1620953
Change-Id: I001f3b940089ccd55a932433c2563c143670a4d1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
glance_multiple_locations when NovaEnableRbdBackend=true

glance_multiple_locations does not needed when the
NovaEnableRbdBackend=false, but it is neede when both the
image and the instance storage is rbd and
the show_image_direct_url is enabled.

The condition introduced in Ia7e0558e4f318640981abb44d188e3479b5eae69

commit_message:
Move heat domain/user creation into keystone profile

This needs to happen on the node running keystone, or things break
when you try to deploy e.g the heat_engine service on a non Controller
role.  We check the enabled flag for heat engine so this only happens
if the heat_engine service is running on some (any) role.

Partial-Bug: #1631130
Change-Id: Ib088a572b384b479f51d56555734d78ab840a1f3
(cherry picked from commit 9ca75667940a203cd0536cb64c9966f4f951c95b)

commit_message:
Ceilometer cannot create standalone mysql database

Users can configure standalone database but bootstrap takes
wrong address - instead of cluster VIP it should take
ceilometer_database_mysql_address. The latter is set to VIP by
default.

Change-Id: I7fc789e53565190c1d3b9966dc67f668237ebd83
Closes-Bug: #1634083

subject: Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 17:00:24.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/ceph_auth.yml', 'tasks/ceph_auth_extra_compute.yml', 'tasks/ceph_preinstall_apt.yml'], 'message': "Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I38d32136b3721da499b7c13722a20d0eb5056de5
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cf56576b10fe4425a7d3e33cb959a83aae9a3df1)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I38d32136b3721da499b7c13722a20d0eb5056de5
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cf56576b10fe4425a7d3e33cb959a83aae9a3df1)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-16 13:36:28.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_client_install_yum.yml'], 'message': 'Do not ignore_errors for fallback keyserver

The initial keyserver usage should ignore errors so that
the fallback keyserver can be used. However the second
task should not ignore errors as there is no third
keyserver - if the first has failed, and the fallback has
failed, then the task should fail and the installation
should stop.

Change-Id: I6869ca71d81ab6cb39c328925583c9a9d81844bb
'}]
commit_message:
Do not ignore_errors for fallback keyserver

The initial keyserver usage should ignore errors so that
the fallback keyserver can be used. However the second
task should not ignore errors as there is no third
keyserver - if the first has failed, and the fallback has
failed, then the task should fail and the installation
should stop.

Change-Id: I6869ca71d81ab6cb39c328925583c9a9d81844bb

commit_message:
Move to use Tempest tests for Neutron

We're seeing a lot of gate failures due to race conditions that are
causing various failures (dhcp agent not starting in time, iptables
rules not being added in time etc.)

To avoid recreating tempest, lets use tempest to test using the
networking api tests.

Change-Id: I624d1c7ebbc191b1ddb89eef22dd120df6bb5415

commit_message:
Refactor get_manager_for_store in an OO manner

get_manager_for_store is a weird function that switches based on the
class type of the first parameter. This is an odd throw back to pre
object orientated days where the object defines what it wants. Refactor
it to put the class on the object.

Change-Id: I0bca2607267aef3bda720cdfbbbe0e5a8093a20d

commit_message:
Fix stale namespace removal issue

When using both /run and /run/netns in docker container, mount
propagation won't work when delete namespace after the containers are
restarted. This PS makes /run mount as shared.

Closes-Bug: #1616268
Change-Id: Ie16699e1b193b2bf1263d89ea634e89ea69add9e

subject: Add support for the Ceph storage driver in Gnocchi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 08:15:38.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_ceph_python_libs.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'templates/gnocchi.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Add support for the Ceph storage driver in Gnocchi

Besides implementing the required configuration entries in gnocchi.conf,
this commit also introduces code to create a symlink for the Python
rados library when the Ceph storage driver is chosen by the deployer.

Creation of Ceph Python library symlinks is usually done by the
ceph_client role. However, Gnocchi is different because it needs Ceph
access to be working when the DB sync task is run. Because the venv may
not exist before the os_gnocchi role runs, or because it might be
destroyed and recreated by the role, we need to create the symlink in
the os_gnocchi role itself.

Change-Id: I6b831867079bc24964c323e2784782d4eae30763
(cherry picked from commit fb65850dbe37cad2920aa3738d96bf8ab47eecfb)
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for the Ceph storage driver in Gnocchi

Besides implementing the required configuration entries in gnocchi.conf,
this commit also introduces code to create a symlink for the Python
rados library when the Ceph storage driver is chosen by the deployer.

Creation of Ceph Python library symlinks is usually done by the
ceph_client role. However, Gnocchi is different because it needs Ceph
access to be working when the DB sync task is run. Because the venv may
not exist before the os_gnocchi role runs, or because it might be
destroyed and recreated by the role, we need to create the symlink in
the os_gnocchi role itself.

Change-Id: I6b831867079bc24964c323e2784782d4eae30763
(cherry picked from commit fb65850dbe37cad2920aa3738d96bf8ab47eecfb)

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,

conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ie6f04bac9023d9f97b80f8de6911f09c338f3027
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit bb58d18a39cb06b0aea0bef3b1bbb2c1ea13a9f7)

commit_message:
sys_call hook: Open subprocces streams in preferred encoding

This patch fixes encoding of stdout/stderr streams opened
by sys_call hook for py3. They now will be opened in
encoding preferred by python locale. This helps to avoid
manual decoding of binary stream and removes 'b' prefix
from string that returned from sys_call plugin.

Change-Id: I93bd2daf6e5ee2893d9cf36658e5acf76dac04d2

subject: DVR: Fix race condition in default route update for fip gateway
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7016, 'name': 'Swaminathan Vasudevan', 'email': 'swvasude@cisco.com', 'username': 'souminathan'}, {'_account_id': 8873, 'name': 'Assaf Muller', 'email': 'amuller@redhat.com', 'username': 'amuller'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10652, 'name': 'Erik Colnick', 'email': 'erikcolnick@gmail.com', 'username': 'ecolnick'}, {'_account_id': 12444, 'name': 'John Schwarz', 'email': 'jschwarz@redhat.com', 'username': 'jschwarz'}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-10-13 20:18:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_fip_ns.py'], 'message': "DVR: Fix race condition in default route update for fip gateway

Under large scale environment we have seen, when
a router update is happening to create the fip namespace
and if there is another router update for the same or different
router that is coming before the first router update completes,
there is a race.
In create_dvr_fip_interfaces, it check for the fip agent
gateway port in the fip_ns object and if available it
assumes that the fip namespace is ready and then starts
to process the gateway update if any.
When trying to update the route for the gateway it fails,
since the 'fg-' device in the fip namespace is not completely
ready.

So the fix here is to check for the 'fg-' ports existence
and if it has a valid IP in the namespace before the gateway
route update happens.

If fails, then throw a warning message and raise an Exception,
so that we can update the route in the next router update or
else the first process will complete by then creating the
default gateway route.

Closes-Bug: #1631513
Change-Id: I20a2c1d8462819e89c4657ca7a39ffa01e87d4b0
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Fix race condition in default route update for fip gateway

Under large scale environment we have seen, when
a router update is happening to create the fip namespace
and if there is another router update for the same or different
router that is coming before the first router update completes,
there is a race.
In create_dvr_fip_interfaces, it check for the fip agent
gateway port in the fip_ns object and if available it
assumes that the fip namespace is ready and then starts
to process the gateway update if any.
When trying to update the route for the gateway it fails,
since the 'fg-' device in the fip namespace is not completely
ready.

So the fix here is to check for the 'fg-' ports existence
and if it has a valid IP in the namespace before the gateway
route update happens.

If fails, then throw a warning message and raise an Exception,
so that we can update the route in the next router update or
else the first process will complete by then creating the
default gateway route.

Closes-Bug: #1631513
Change-Id: I20a2c1d8462819e89c4657ca7a39ffa01e87d4b0

commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I38d32136b3721da499b7c13722a20d0eb5056de5
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Deploy files for multiple ceph clusters

Deploy necessary configs and keyrings for multiple
ceph cluters.  Specifically, the intent is to enable
multiple backends for cinder that can be accessed by
compute nodes.

This change will allow automatic retrieval of
ceph.conf and client keyrings from multiple ceph clusters.
Additionally, libvirt ceph client secrets will be created
to support attaching volumes to instances from multiple
ceph clusters.

Change-Id: Icee061b35f374955154a3dd703444b94da0117da
(cherry picked from commit f3eeb2fa15c65a1c9c8baa14fd62f4d449517b1a)

commit_message:
Refresh DeployIdentifier as well on update

The package update was not refreshing the DeployIdentifier, so puppet
was never actually running. This adds the DeployIdentifier to the
heat update call.

Closes-Bug: #1522943

Instead of using an operator to make sure we upgrade package before any
service, which causes dependency cycles with iptables puppet module,
let's do another approach where we upgrade rpms in the 'setup' stage,
which is a stage that runs before configure and running services.

In that way, we'll remove dependency cycles and make sure packages are
upgrades before configure and running TripleO services.

Change-Id: I1be83f88be1959885c980ab4f428477d412751f7
(cherry picked from commit 45783d1c643b7a47454207b3a90575f1ed8ab46d)
"}]
commit_message:
packages: run upgrade at 'setup' stage

Instead of using an operator to make sure we upgrade package before any
service, which causes dependency cycles with iptables puppet module,
let's do another approach where we upgrade rpms in the 'setup' stage,
which is a stage that runs before configure and running services.

In that way, we'll remove dependency cycles and make sure packages are
upgrades before configure and running TripleO services.

Change-Id: I1be83f88be1959885c980ab4f428477d412751f7
(cherry picked from commit 45783d1c643b7a47454207b3a90575f1ed8ab46d)

commit_message:
Add support for the Ceph storage driver in Gnocchi

This commit adds support for the ceph_client role to be run on the
Gnocchi containers. The role will only setup the Ceph client in these
containers when `gnocchi_storage_driver` is set to `ceph`.

Change-Id: I7cd717c81ec4e9e0db6d74e645c83b426d3503cf
(cherry picked from commit 5733209bc44fedc837dbe35f29e398975ba3f652)

subject: Use dictionary for service group mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 14:59:45.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/glance_post_install.yml', 'templates/glance-systemd-init.j2', 'tasks/main.yml', 'tests/inventory', 'templates/glance-upstart-init.j2', 'tasks/glance_init.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/glance_init_upstart.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/glance_init_common.yml', 'tasks/glance_init_systemd.yml', 'templates/glance-systemd-tempfiles.j2'], 'message': "Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'glance_service_names' from a list to a dictionary mapping
of services, groups that install those services. This brings the
method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order to
implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: Ia74bbcac35c27928f7e96056b9449932253b75de
(cherry picked from commit 3e522f6ef914130a91c7a6b90433bed04e302123)

commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'glance_service_names' from a list to a dictionary mapping
of services, groups that install those services. This brings the
method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order to
implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: Ia74bbcac35c27928f7e96056b9449932253b75de
(cherry picked from commit 3e522f6ef914130a91c7a6b90433bed04e302123)

commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I9ce8a41be134eaff336f6da7886db8461f333953
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0827b69aa716079660bc5bd736389140792fa16e)

commit_message:
Fix stale namespace removal issue

When using both /run and /run/netns in docker container, mount
propagation won't work when delete namespace after the containers are
restarted. This PS makes /run mount as shared.

Closes-Bug: #1616268
Change-Id: Ie16699e1b193b2bf1263d89ea634e89ea69add9e

This patch adds the networkList() method to the OpenStack wrapper
class. This method will initialize `Neutron` instance if needed and

commit_message:
Added networkList() method to OpenStack wrapper

This patch adds the networkList() method to the OpenStack wrapper
class. This method will initialize `Neutron` instance if needed and
cache it. As neutron needs the URL, `Keystone` instance is also
initialize and cache if needed.

Change-Id: If12af29a86b9856a145c1f91de25eb3473938de5

commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I298510082bcecb0b84eb252851f8044d8b7f7f61
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6642af670f67e30c99e03cf3ebcade5fc79bf811)

commit_message:
Fetch the snmpd_readonly_user_password from the Mistral environment

The snmpd readonly password is stored in a Mistral environment by
instack so it can be accessed by Mistral as the Hiera approach wasn't
working. This updates the password action to use the new password
source.

Closes-Bug: #1631279
Depends-On: I71edae4a4dee2204edf32e3b2800f075d221b856
Change-Id: I94428d1deb000c65a1c0266d01f660b76d4a3ee5

subject: Fix handling of old git log output
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 4159, 'name': 'Cory Stone', 'email': 'corystone@gmail.com', 'username': 'corystone'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 9453, 'name': 'James Polley', 'email': 'jp@jamezpolley.com', 'username': 'tchaypo'}, {'_account_id': 12612, 'name': 'Sachi King', 'email': 'nakato@nakato.io', 'username': 'nakato'}, {'_account_id': 16366, 'name': 'Randall Nortman', 'email': 'openstack@nortman.net', 'username': 'rnortman'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-16 02:18:09.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_setup.py', 'pbr/git.py'], 'message': 'Fix handling of old git log output

Older versions of git produce log output (using --format specifiers)
that doesn't prefix tags with a "tag:" prefix, though they do using
the --decorate log format.  This was a bug in git that was fixed, but
the older git is still in the wild.  This change combines both the new
--format specifier method with the --decorate method to find tags even
if used with the old, buggy git, while (hopefully) avoiding
identifying non-tags as tags.

This is based on I6b557687f2428a528a8aa7f76e84797162488887 but tries to
use a single format string that works across all versions of git.

Because the format string has changed, some of the test data has had to
change to reflect the new format.

Change-Id: I58a1b12e0f4054fd25bddc77fabb6c89239561ff
Closes-Bug: #1570458
Co-Authored-By: James Polley <jp@jamezpolley.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of old git log output

Older versions of git produce log output (using --format specifiers)
that doesn't prefix tags with a "tag:" prefix, though they do using
the --decorate log format.  This was a bug in git that was fixed, but
the older git is still in the wild.  This change combines both the new
--format specifier method with the --decorate method to find tags even
if used with the old, buggy git, while (hopefully) avoiding
identifying non-tags as tags.

This is based on I6b557687f2428a528a8aa7f76e84797162488887 but tries to
use a single format string that works across all versions of git.

Because the format string has changed, some of the test data has had to
change to reflect the new format.

Change-Id: I58a1b12e0f4054fd25bddc77fabb6c89239561ff
Closes-Bug: #1570458
Co-Authored-By: James Polley <jp@jamezpolley.com>

commit_message:
Add portgroups support to ironic virt driver

This patch allows to chose nic type for instance, that will be placed
on ironic node by specifying extra property in flavor: portgroup=True.

Change-Id: I60bfc588a0d5c79bc9d5b02286c3dc2afc660892

commit_message:
rest: using ujson to deserialize

use faster ujson to deserialize the json data in the rest api.
when loading in 20metrics x 720points each:
- native json lib takes 0.105s
- ujson lib takes 0.00758s

Change-Id: I0f545a14237ae090833a30a5530f5c6d1e4587c3
Closes-Bug: #1625654

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-11 11:43:16.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_node_disks.py'], 'message': "Logging in finding disk function fixed

The funcion find_existing_disk is called in the VolumeManager constructor.
When the new node is discovered and nailgun-agent doesn't post yet nodes
info to the Nailgun we have no volumes info and have warning and error
messages in the logs on each VolumeManager object initialization.
On empty volumes data we shouldn't perform search in find_existing_disk.
Just log message and return None.

Change-Id: Ia7ffc5f69995dc4230f5984faaa08ae543bbe044
Closes-Bug: #1523471
"}]
commit_message:
Logging in finding disk function fixed

The funcion find_existing_disk is called in the VolumeManager constructor.
When the new node is discovered and nailgun-agent doesn't post yet nodes
info to the Nailgun we have no volumes info and have warning and error
messages in the logs on each VolumeManager object initialization.
On empty volumes data we shouldn't perform search in find_existing_disk.
Just log message and return None.

Change-Id: Ia7ffc5f69995dc4230f5984faaa08ae543bbe044
Closes-Bug: #1523471

commit_message:
Remove html_static_path from doc

The html_static_path setting in conf.py was forgotten in the patch,
which caused a warning when building docs.
WARNING: html_static_path entry u'/home/devstack/cloudkitty/doc/source
/_static' does not exist.
This patch comments out the setting from conf.py to prevent the warning.

Change-Id: I09666cbedcc68d015fdb60e6f24a3202642dcd96

subject: Extract RPMPackagerMixin
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-06 10:30:09.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/pkg.py'], 'message': 'Extract RPMPackagerMixin

Create a RPMPackagerMixin and base the current RedhatPackagerMixin
on that. This is useful to be able to create other RPM based PackagerMixin
, i.e. for SUSE.
The only methods which are OS specific are _install() and _remove()
which use "yum".

Closes-Bug: #1630937
Change-Id: Id86151e731955ef2bb99a45f3443b027303add5d
'}]
commit_message:
Extract RPMPackagerMixin

Create a RPMPackagerMixin and base the current RedhatPackagerMixin
on that. This is useful to be able to create other RPM based PackagerMixin
, i.e. for SUSE.
The only methods which are OS specific are _install() and _remove()
which use "yum".

Closes-Bug: #1630937
Change-Id: Id86151e731955ef2bb99a45f3443b027303add5d

commit_message:
Remove start section from the pipeline

Presence of start section in check pipeline
leads to unnecessary messages being posted
to upstream Gerrit, it is prohibited by
third-party ci policy in upstream, so we
should remove start section to fix this.

Change-Id: Ic8a6127255061fc7124fcac933a64021dcf66509

commit_message:
Catch DevicePathInUse in attach_volume

DevicePathInUse might be raised in attach action,
we didn't catch it so a 500 error might be returned
to end user.

NOTE: mitaka also includes the legacy_v2 API so this needs to
be patched there to.

Change-Id: Ic9f0979b5adef28bb47756e7fc2ce5a3d6493298
Closes-Bug: 1621452
(cherry picked from commit 6051499a856659290c381e1a80328e48fe8a2199)
(cherry picked from commit 1ef4b725f1df54bc45f6d50a02d9aa65d3bff338)

commit_message:
Fix app detail AttributeError

If the app doesn't have app attribute, the app detail will gives the error:
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get'

This patch fix this.

Change-Id: Ib7a0172e7341ca24d80e2d164419a636d4595881
Closes-Bug: #1633857

subject: Remove hardcode of container_name in backups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 01:45:30.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/backups/forms.py'], 'message': "Remove hardcode of container_name in backups

If user doesn't set container name
for volume backup, Horizon sets default
value 'volumebackups'. If Cinder is configured
with different default value, this behaviour
will cause an error.

Since Cinder is able to handle case when
container name for backup is not set,
we should remove this hardcode from Horizon.

Change-Id: Ib121ac1d38f11e967ef059de57a8198c5e890198
Closes-Bug: #1631930
(cherry picked from commit 1d13a052468ef1b66d1c75f98f52cc356ba81365)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove hardcode of container_name in backups

If user doesn't set container name
for volume backup, Horizon sets default
value 'volumebackups'. If Cinder is configured
with different default value, this behaviour
will cause an error.

Since Cinder is able to handle case when
container name for backup is not set,
we should remove this hardcode from Horizon.

Change-Id: Ib121ac1d38f11e967ef059de57a8198c5e890198
Closes-Bug: #1631930
(cherry picked from commit 1d13a052468ef1b66d1c75f98f52cc356ba81365)

subject: Tune number of workers for undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-14 17:01:58.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Tune number of workers for undercloud

By default many services use the number of cpus as the default number of
workers.  On baremetal systems this can lead to excessive RAM
comsumption as this can be 16, 32, 48 or higher for each of the
services. In the upstream puppet openstack, a fact was created as part
of the Newton cycle that is the larger value between (number of cpus/4)
or 2 but is capped at 8. These defaults have not been updated yet in the
upstream modules and it would be better to specifically call out the
worker configurations in our puppet-stack-config.yaml template.

This change updates the worker settings for the classes that are pulled
in for the undercloud to leverage this tuned fact to lower the overall
number of workers for all the services.  This should improve memory
consumption and reduce the number of processes running on baremetal
systems. The os_workers fact will be 2 for unless the cpu count is
greater than 8 with an incremental increase of 1 worker for every 4
processors until 32 processors.  Anything above 32 processors will still
result in a worker value of 8.

This change updates 17 services that currently may use the number of
processors for the default number of workers.

Change-Id: I9ed855648e23b0a7e452e6a840a92779fa3f6d48
Closes-Bug: #1633544
'}]
commit_message:
Tune number of workers for undercloud

By default many services use the number of cpus as the default number of
workers.  On baremetal systems this can lead to excessive RAM
comsumption as this can be 16, 32, 48 or higher for each of the
services. In the upstream puppet openstack, a fact was created as part
of the Newton cycle that is the larger value between (number of cpus/4)
or 2 but is capped at 8. These defaults have not been updated yet in the
upstream modules and it would be better to specifically call out the
worker configurations in our puppet-stack-config.yaml template.

This change updates the worker settings for the classes that are pulled
in for the undercloud to leverage this tuned fact to lower the overall
number of workers for all the services.  This should improve memory
consumption and reduce the number of processes running on baremetal
systems. The os_workers fact will be 2 for unless the cpu count is
greater than 8 with an incremental increase of 1 worker for every 4
processors until 32 processors.  Anything above 32 processors will still
result in a worker value of 8.

This change updates 17 services that currently may use the number of
processors for the default number of workers.

Change-Id: I9ed855648e23b0a7e452e6a840a92779fa3f6d48
Closes-Bug: #1633544

As per OpenStack Docstrings guide lines [1]:
[H401] Docstrings should not start with a space.
[H403] Multi line docstrings should end on a new line.
[H404] Multi line docstrings should start without a leading new line.
[H405] Multi line docstrings should start with a one line summary
followed by an empty line.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#docstrings

trivialfix

Change-Id: Ifbc123eec81f47f833f93e5a51f34e385767162e
'}]
commit_message:
Docstrings should not start with a space

As per OpenStack Docstrings guide lines [1]:
[H401] Docstrings should not start with a space.
[H403] Multi line docstrings should end on a new line.
[H404] Multi line docstrings should start without a leading new line.
[H405] Multi line docstrings should start with a one line summary
followed by an empty line.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#docstrings

trivialfix

Change-Id: Ifbc123eec81f47f833f93e5a51f34e385767162e

subject: Use dictionary for service group mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-10-12 14:42:22.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/glance_post_install.yml', 'templates/glance-systemd-init.j2', 'tasks/main.yml', 'tests/inventory', 'templates/glance-upstart-init.j2', 'tasks/glance_init.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/glance_init_upstart.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/glance_init_common.yml', 'tasks/glance_init_systemd.yml', 'templates/glance-systemd-tempfiles.j2'], 'message': "Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'glance_service_names' from a list to a dictionary mapping
of services, groups that install those services. This brings the
method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order to
implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: Ia74bbcac35c27928f7e96056b9449932253b75de
"}]
commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'glance_service_names' from a list to a dictionary mapping
of services, groups that install those services. This brings the
method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order to
implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: Ia74bbcac35c27928f7e96056b9449932253b75de

Those default params are automatically generated by pbr[1]. There appears to

file format from pbr, but as input for setuptools.setup(). This removes the
need for an explicit ‘MANIFEST.in’ file.

commit_message:
Remove some default params in MANIFEST.in

Those default params are automatically generated by pbr[1]. There appears to
be no good reason to keep them around. We don't generate MANIFEST.in in a
file format from pbr, but as input for setuptools.setup(). This removes the
need for an explicit ‘MANIFEST.in’ file.

[1]https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/blob/master/pbr/packaging.py#L454

Change-Id: Ifc4cb65553152f3e26cdd3781bbb5ac2f6a00b02

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-10-14 22:17:37.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/tripleo_packages_spec.rb', 'manifests/packages.pp', 'manifests/packages/upgrades.pp'], 'message': "packages: run upgrade at 'setup' stage

Instead of using an operator to make sure we upgrade package before any
service, which causes dependency cycles with iptables puppet module,
let's do another approach where we upgrade rpms in the 'setup' stage,
which is a stage that runs before configure and running services.

In that way, we'll remove dependency cycles and make sure packages are
upgrades before configure and running TripleO services.

Change-Id: I1be83f88be1959885c980ab4f428477d412751f7
"}]
commit_message:
packages: run upgrade at 'setup' stage

Instead of using an operator to make sure we upgrade package before any
service, which causes dependency cycles with iptables puppet module,
let's do another approach where we upgrade rpms in the 'setup' stage,
which is a stage that runs before configure and running services.

In that way, we'll remove dependency cycles and make sure packages are
upgrades before configure and running TripleO services.

Change-Id: I1be83f88be1959885c980ab4f428477d412751f7

subject: Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 21:44:27.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/openstack_kernel_tuning.yml', 'tasks/openstack_kernel_modules.yml'], 'message': "Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Icd0afaaf8f0d9c5e06751f284f99985af6a924c6
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Icd0afaaf8f0d9c5e06751f284f99985af6a924c6
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Containers should use the same TZ setting as the host machine. This

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 49979680bd10f7a19f979119028392bb9e36d608)

commit_message:
Copy system localtime when creating container cache

Containers should use the same TZ setting as the host machine. This
change ensures that all containers created are using iheriting the
system's "/etc/localtime" which ensurs that the container and the host
are running on the same TZ at build time.

Change-Id: Ica571d9dc280bf46be475b6a83ada47fd3410d92
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 49979680bd10f7a19f979119028392bb9e36d608)

subject: Fixes SSLError during cclient.meters.list() by https
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 16198, 'name': 'Ilya Popov', 'email': 'hebulrih@gmail.com', 'username': 'IPO'}, {'_account_id': 23382, 'name': 'Artem Tiumentcev', 'email': 'AITyumentsev.SBT@sberbank.ru', 'username': 'darland'}, {'_account_id': 23815, 'name': 'Dmitri Plakhov', 'email': 'info@openstack.school', 'username': 'dplakhov'}, {'_account_id': 23871, 'name': 'MargaritaShakhova', 'email': 'shakhova.margarita@gmail.com', 'username': 'MargaritaShakhova'}, {'_account_id': 23873, 'name': 'Aleksey Nakoryakov', 'email': 'bargool@gmail.com', 'username': 'bargool'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-17 12:22:30.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/tests/unit/test_client.py', 'ceilometerclient/client.py'], 'message': "Fixes SSLError during cclient.meters.list() by https

    The problem causes the function _adjust_kwargs(kwargs) which creates
    a new dict client_kwargs with new-named keys. It gets 'os_insecure' key
    from kwargs and gives it key-name 'insecure'.
    But the bug is in using kwargs.get('insecure') <which is None> to
    produse value of 'verify'.

Change-Id: If77b2d3c75beddcd1a0a82353b56c84b29184ec7
Closes-Bug: 1634027
Related-Bug: 1394449
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes SSLError during cclient.meters.list() by https

    The problem causes the function _adjust_kwargs(kwargs) which creates
    a new dict client_kwargs with new-named keys. It gets 'os_insecure' key
    from kwargs and gives it key-name 'insecure'.
    But the bug is in using kwargs.get('insecure') <which is None> to
    produse value of 'verify'.

Change-Id: If77b2d3c75beddcd1a0a82353b56c84b29184ec7
Closes-Bug: 1634027
Related-Bug: 1394449

commit_message:
Do not move task status to running after ack

Astute will send 'running' status for task
when start to process it, so we do not need
task in orchestrator mechanism.

Change-Id: I5e2deccdbd27daff3e3b131ef9c8c7ffbbb40dd4
Closes-Bug: #1621003

The 'Drop authorized keys file script locally' task shouldn't
specifically require that the first member of the nova_compute group be
available. If the playbook is run with a limit excluding that host, the
task will always end up being skipped.

Use an intersect filter to find the first available compute host within

Closes-Bug: 1632447
Change-Id: Id12fd6cee104a6fb705acc66704f21d629694d84
(cherry picked from commit 3f91e25a0a427db45d9919f4624d0dc0f6ef3dd0)

commit_message:
Delegate from first available compute host

The 'Drop authorized keys file script locally' task shouldn't
specifically require that the first member of the nova_compute group be
available. If the playbook is run with a limit excluding that host, the
task will always end up being skipped.

Use an intersect filter to find the first available compute host within
the play and use that as the delegation host.

Closes-Bug: 1632447
Change-Id: Id12fd6cee104a6fb705acc66704f21d629694d84
(cherry picked from commit 3f91e25a0a427db45d9919f4624d0dc0f6ef3dd0)

subject: Add conditional for multi-domain support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 13:21:45.000000000', 'files': ['templates/horizon_local_settings.py.j2'], 'message': 'Add conditional for multi-domain support

When running a multi-domain cloud the constant
"OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_DOMAIN" needs to be omitted from the
rendered "local_setting.py" file. This change keys off of the
"horizon_keystone_multidomain_support" value and should it be `true`
the constant "OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_DOMAIN" will be omitted from
config.

Closes-Bug: #1629865
Change-Id: I81c5d17bfd4d946567a49db9adfb4285d05303c3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 92d57b525e2c756d713ad5a3fd5f0f1f325cf9f9)
'}]
commit_message:
Add conditional for multi-domain support

When running a multi-domain cloud the constant
"OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_DOMAIN" needs to be omitted from the
rendered "local_setting.py" file. This change keys off of the
"horizon_keystone_multidomain_support" value and should it be `true`
the constant "OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_DOMAIN" will be omitted from
config.

Closes-Bug: #1629865
Change-Id: I81c5d17bfd4d946567a49db9adfb4285d05303c3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 92d57b525e2c756d713ad5a3fd5f0f1f325cf9f9)

subject: Remove getRegion() calls from network initializers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 17:18:12.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/NeutronNetwork.yaml', 'meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/ExistingNeutronNetwork.yaml', 'meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/NeutronNetworkBase.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove getRegion() calls from network initializers

.init methods of the components are called before
the environment is initialized. Thus regions are not
configured at this point. Thus if the object is not
directly or indirectly owned by the CloudRegion
it cannot call getRegion() from the initializer.

Normally networks do belong to CloudRegion
so there is no problem. However a Network instance
such as ExistingNetwork might be passed to the Instance
class which is not owned by the ClouydRegion and in this
case an exception will be thrown.

Change-Id: I1f3c4f53d4ebc92772c79c9991b19840aa0b0ed7
Closes-Bug: #1633096
'}]
commit_message:
Remove getRegion() calls from network initializers

.init methods of the components are called before
the environment is initialized. Thus regions are not
configured at this point. Thus if the object is not
directly or indirectly owned by the CloudRegion
it cannot call getRegion() from the initializer.

Normally networks do belong to CloudRegion
so there is no problem. However a Network instance
such as ExistingNetwork might be passed to the Instance
class which is not owned by the ClouydRegion and in this
case an exception will be thrown.

Change-Id: I1f3c4f53d4ebc92772c79c9991b19840aa0b0ed7
Closes-Bug: #1633096

commit_message:
Always setup ResellerAdmin role in keystone

The ResellerAdmin role should be setup in keystone regardless of whether
we are using Ceilometer or not. This will allow operators to add the
ResellerAdmin role to users - which should then be allowed to operate on
any account.

Change-Id: I3c5ede01266b126705b42b086107a9232a85bf94
Closes-Bug: #1633221
(cherry picked from commit 8e14baa7fb27d43d5845818660517938644db0b6)

commit_message:
Create log aggregation parent directory

During lxc hosts setup, mv command fails if the log aggregation
parent /openstack/log/ does not exist. This patch makes sure that
the directory exists before calling mv command.

Change-Id: I3a337b73fcaa446164d1bc8bbae73dbeea694d7d
Closes-Bug: #1612374

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-30 20:53:52.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Fix block and shared migration for live-migrate

Currently, the options for shared migration and block migrations are
reversed.  When you supply the block-migration option, it sets the
value to false on the webservice call, and the shared-migration option
sets it to true.

This change will change the block_migration value to be true when
a user specifies the block migration option, and set it to be false
when the user specifies a shared migration.

Change-Id: I81611c1c918d356c7720d6c614907056f29f0841
Closes-Bug: #1518059
'}]
commit_message:
Fix block and shared migration for live-migrate

Currently, the options for shared migration and block migrations are
reversed.  When you supply the block-migration option, it sets the
value to false on the webservice call, and the shared-migration option
sets it to true.

This change will change the block_migration value to be true when
a user specifies the block migration option, and set it to be false
when the user specifies a shared migration.

Change-Id: I81611c1c918d356c7720d6c614907056f29f0841
Closes-Bug: #1518059

subject: Move systemd handler above restart handler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 20:26:42.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'message': 'Move systemd handler above restart handler

Since handlers are executed in the order in which they are defined
the handler to restart systemd should come before the handlers to
restart mysql. This avoids the error case where the playbook is run
multiple times and systemd refuses to restart mysql giving the
following message:

"Warning: mysql.service changed on disk. Run 'systemctl
daemon-reload' to reload units."

Closes-Bug: #1633472

Change-Id: I3962c0e8f9f1cf3c01a3160be4c744e9fbd1ecfe
(cherry picked from commit 678128f13ad22308819c83a208beeec8ea109b0f)
'}]
commit_message:
Move systemd handler above restart handler

Since handlers are executed in the order in which they are defined
the handler to restart systemd should come before the handlers to
restart mysql. This avoids the error case where the playbook is run
multiple times and systemd refuses to restart mysql giving the
following message:

"Warning: mysql.service changed on disk. Run 'systemctl
daemon-reload' to reload units."

Closes-Bug: #1633472

Change-Id: I3962c0e8f9f1cf3c01a3160be4c744e9fbd1ecfe
(cherry picked from commit 678128f13ad22308819c83a208beeec8ea109b0f)

commit_message:
Add strategy template doc

Developer should provide a detailled documentation about his strategy
algorithm to make it even easier to use by a Watcher end user.
I propose in this changeset a template for strategy documentation.
you will find also a example with basic consolidation strategy.

commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I7067a541362c826579fc7d17abf86fe9ddc89bee
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-15 00:20:52.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/quickstart-extras.yml'], 'message': 'Explicitly cast variables in quickstart-extras playbook

By default, when an argument is passed in via the commandline to
ansible it will be cast as a string. This makes our options for
the different validation methods in quickstart-extras.yml difficult
to use from the commandline.

This patch fixes that by explicitly casting these variables to
booleans.

Change-Id: I8e9a483dc1f3482765945d7340f717b81e444234
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly cast variables in quickstart-extras playbook

By default, when an argument is passed in via the commandline to
ansible it will be cast as a string. This makes our options for
the different validation methods in quickstart-extras.yml difficult
to use from the commandline.

This patch fixes that by explicitly casting these variables to
booleans.

Change-Id: I8e9a483dc1f3482765945d7340f717b81e444234

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 20:26:32.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/container_create.yml'], 'message': 'Drop container setup script independent of container_networks

There is no reason there should be a loop or anything dependent on
container_networks being defined with this task as far as I can tell.

Since this task is skipped if container_networks is not set, the next
task will fail the role any time there are no container networks.

Change-Id: Id257fa3aa124b51f066d7ec0d4c30f4c8fb56e24
(cherry picked from commit e3ee9c545d393c79880f56df571202f7ce8f16a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Drop container setup script independent of container_networks

There is no reason there should be a loop or anything dependent on
container_networks being defined with this task as far as I can tell.

Since this task is skipped if container_networks is not set, the next
task will fail the role any time there are no container networks.

Change-Id: Id257fa3aa124b51f066d7ec0d4c30f4c8fb56e24
(cherry picked from commit e3ee9c545d393c79880f56df571202f7ce8f16a1)

commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ibc6f84428699a0a54c0f24d54b1390af6a041f9f
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Add conditional for multi-domain support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 19:35:41.000000000', 'files': ['templates/horizon_local_settings.py.j2'], 'message': 'Add conditional for multi-domain support

When running a multi-domain cloud the constant
"OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_DOMAIN" needs to be omitted from the
rendered "local_setting.py" file. This change keys off of the
"horizon_keystone_multidomain_support" value and should it be `true`
the constant "OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_DOMAIN" will be omitted from
config.

Closes-Bug: #1629865
Change-Id: I81c5d17bfd4d946567a49db9adfb4285d05303c3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add conditional for multi-domain support

When running a multi-domain cloud the constant
"OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_DOMAIN" needs to be omitted from the
rendered "local_setting.py" file. This change keys off of the
"horizon_keystone_multidomain_support" value and should it be `true`
the constant "OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_DOMAIN" will be omitted from
config.

Closes-Bug: #1629865
Change-Id: I81c5d17bfd4d946567a49db9adfb4285d05303c3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 21:45:57.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/neutron_install.yml'], 'message': "Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I0e6b5fc5b10e379485cec5c58acca4b315d4a6c4
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'ignore_errors: true' in favor of 'failed_when: false'

This change removes the use of 'ignore_errors: true' because it causes deployers
to see red output and a stacktrace, which traditionally means something is broken,
even when the failure is known to have a fall back option or be intentional. This
conversion will provide a generally cleaner interface.

It should be noted that the 'failed' filter will still function normally. Tasks
with the 'failed_when: false' option will still be marked as 'failed' in any
registered variable. This change simply makes the output look cleaner.

Change-Id: I0e6b5fc5b10e379485cec5c58acca4b315d4a6c4
Closes-Bug: #1633438
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
